description: Change of use from class C3 (Dwelling) to class C4 (HMO) for maximum 6 occupants with provision of refuse storage; single storey side extension (following demolition of existing garage); relocation of front door from side to front elevation; single storey rear extension; alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension incorporating Juliet balcony and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope; creation of bicycle storage to front elevation; internal chimney breast removed; alterations to rear landscape
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: LILGA-L001 (Existing Location Plans); LILGA-E001 (Existing Front and Rear Elevation); LILGA-E002 (Existing Side Elevation); LILGA-S001 (Existing Section AA); LILGA-S002 (Existing Section BB); LILGA-P001 (Existing Ground Floor Plan); LILGA-P002 (Existing First Floor Plan); LILGA-P003 (Existing Loft Plan); LILGA-P004 (Existing Roof Plan); LILGA-L501 Rev B (Proposed Location Plans); LILGA-E501 (Proposed Front and Rear Elevation); LILGA-E502 (Proposed Side Elevation); LILGA-S501 (Proposed Section AA); LILGA-P501 Rev B (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); LILGA-P502 Rev B (Proposed First Floor Plan); LILGA-P503 Rev B (Proposed Loft Plan); LILGA-P504 Rev B (Proposed Roof Plan); LILGA-D501 (Proposed Bin and Cycle Storage); Design and Access Statement Dated November 2022.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings listed under condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The bicycle storage identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
REASON: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse bin storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses, namely, bedrooms adjoining/below/above communal main entrance or kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the
Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Any mitigation measures required shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than six (6) persons within six (6) bedrooms.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines.
